banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: Do insects have personalities?

nodes.whoTheyAre:
Living in Debrecen, currently doing her PhD in biology after her zoological specialization master, MELINDA BABITS had always been fascinated by insects and other invertebrates. Caring for such creepy-crawly animals and observing their behaviour started as a hobby while she was in highschool and after being accepted to the University of Debrecen it became her passion and profession as well.
She has started working at the Behavioural Ecology Research Group in 2013. Her main area of interest is the relationship between the social environment and individual-level behaviour in arthropods.

videoData.description: Have you confused a bee with a wasp, or an ant with a termite? Are all bugs the same to you? Zoologist Melinda Babits aims to change your mind. Babits' insightful research on insect behavior suggests that bugs are creatures with distinct personalities — and that studying their conduct might teach us a thing or two about human interaction.
